glsa.title: PEAR Net_Traceroute: Command injection
glsa.synopsis: An input sanitation error in PEAR Net_Traceroute might allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary commands.

background.p: PEAR Net_Traceroute is an OS independent wrapper class for executing traceroute calls from PHP.

description.p: Pasquale Imperato reported that the $host parameter to the traceroute() function in Traceroute.php is not properly sanitized before being passed to exec().

impact.p: A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability when user input is passed directly to PEAR Net_Traceroute in a PHP script, possibly resulting in the remote execution of arbitrary shell commands with the privileges of the user running the affected PHP script.

workaround.p: Ensure that all data that is passed to the traceroute() function is properly shell escaped (for instance using the escapeshellcmd() function).
